intro: Colysis hemitoma, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a perennial plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes and a tall, erect stem that bears a single, large, umbrella-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Its leaves are typically broad, arrow-shaped, and have a waxy texture. The plant is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
